titleStmt.title: William H. Baker to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6474

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Ligislative Hall
May 22d 1865
Thos E Bramlette
Govnor Kentucky
Dear Sir

I Send you the petition of Sundree Cittizens of Boone County Asking you to Remit a fine the facts are as Stated in pitition Arnold & four others was fined at the Same term of the Court the oath for the Same offence the other four Sent you a petition last Spring and Got their fines Remitted Mr Arnold thought his name was included in their petition but by mistake was left out he now petitions your Excelency to Rimit his fine you will please
attend to this at your Earlist Convenience and much oblige
